summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Delta Airlines, Inc., requesting all passenger and related records for Ghislaine Maxwell from 1994-1998 and July 2019 onward. It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking.

persons.name: Judy Gorham
persons.context: Addressed as the recipient of the grand jury subpoena on behalf of Delta Airlines, Inc., to whom the subpoena and request for non-disclosure are directed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all records (passenger, payment, membership, etc.) for Ghislaine Maxwell, also known as Ghislaine Borgerson, for two time periods: 1994-1998 and July 2019 onward, as part of a federal criminal investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance for Delta Records
events.description: Delta Airlines, Inc., through its representative, is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury in New York to testify and produce records related to Ghislaine Maxwell, unless records are produced via a custodian declaration.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to Delta Airlines
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Delta Airlines for records on Ghislaine Maxwell, accompanied by a formal request to keep the subpoena confidential.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Delta Airlines, Inc., P.O. Box 20574, Atlanta, GA 30320
The Silvio J. Atollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Delta Airlines on January 23, 2020, seeking all travel and related records for Ghislaine Maxwell from 1994-1998 and from July 2019 onward.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws including sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), conspiracy to commit sex trafficking (ยง 1594(c)), coercion and enticement (ยง 2422(b)), and conspiracy (ยง 371).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested Delta Airlines not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
The subpoena indicates an active federal criminal investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's activities was underway as of early 2020, focusing on evidence potentially held by a major airline.
